products.name: Cherries - Seedless
products.description: A maraschino cherry is a preserved, sweetened cherry, typically made from light-colored sweet cherries such as the Royal Ann,[1] Rainier, or Gold varieties. In their modern form, the cherries are first preserved in a brine solution usually containing sulfur dioxide and calcium chloride to bleach the fruit, then soaked in a suspension of food coloring

products.name: Mushroom - Morels, Dry
products.description: Morchella, the true morels, is a genus of edible sac fungi closely related to anatomically simpler cup fungi in the order Pezizales (division Ascomycota). These distinctive fungi have a honeycomb appearance due to the network of ridges with pits composing their caps. Morels are prized by gourmet cooks

products.name: Beets - Golden
products.description: FULL SUN Native to the coastal regions of southern Europe, the beet has been cultivated since prehistoric times for its green tops. Not until the 1500s was the vegetable cultivated for its roots. Detroit Golden is an improved variety of an ancient beet known as 'Golden Beet' and grown in the US before 1828.

products.name: Salad - Mixed, Veg
products.description: The Romans, ancient Greeks, Persians and Indians ate mixed greens with dressing, a type of mixed salad. Salads, including layered and dressed salads, have been popular in Europe since the Greek and Roman imperial expansions.

products.name: Potatoes - Purple, Organic
products.description: Purple inside and out, these delightful purple-blue potatoes are a crowd favorite! These small potatoes are great for mashing, baking, roasting or even making colorful hash browns!

products.name: Cheese - Parmigiano Reggiano
products.description: Legend has it, that around 900 years ago, Benedictine monks, living in the Parma-Reggio region of Italy, created this cheese when they needed to find a way to extend the shelf-life of the large quantity of milk they were producing.

products.name: Fish - Frozen
products.description: Delicious fish friends preserved in our well-constructed ice boxes

products.name: Milk - Two Percent
products.description: Reduced-fat milk is labeled as 2 percent milk, which means the milkfat is 2 percent of the total weight of the milk—not that an 8-ounce glass of milk contains 2 percent fat.

products.name: Squash - Magda
products.description: Middle Eastern Cousa Magda is a summer squash available from June throughout the summer months.

products.name: Bananas - Yellow
products.description: The yellow sweet banana is a mutant strain of the cooking banana, discovered in 1836 by Jamaican Jean Francois Poujot, who found one of the banana trees on his plantation was bearing yellow fruit rather than green or red

products.name: Nantucket - Pomegranate Pear
products.description: Crisp and refreshing blend of pomegranate and pear

products.name: Cheese - Mascarpone
products.description: Mascarpone originated during the Middle Ages in Lombardy, a region in the northern part of Italy with a rich dairy and agricultural heritage. In the 1500s and 1600s, dairymen in the region became famous for selling fresh cheese curds, known as mascarpone.

products.name: Cheese - Goat With Herbs
products.description: Boursin [buʁsɛ̃] is a brand of Gournay cheese. It is a soft creamy cheese available in a variety of flavours, with a flavour and texture somewhat similar to cream cheese.

products.name: Fish - Salmon
products.description: Salmon is a common food fish classified as an oily fish with a rich content of protein and omega-3 fatty acids.

products.name: Beef - Ground
products.description: Ground beef, minced beef or beef mince is beef that has been finely chopped with a knife or a meat grinder (American English) mincer or mincing machine (British English). It is used in many recipes including hamburgers, bolognese sauce, meatloaf, meatballs and kofta.

products.name: Seaweed - Green Sheets
products.description: Straight from the seas of monsters; Our seaweed will have you boasting like a seal

products.name: Split Peas - Yellow, Dry
products.description: You won't find a pea in this town split more precisely and evenly than here

products.name: Juice - Lagoon Mango
products.description: Straight from the deep lagoons of Juiceville. Once you try this, you won't be able to let that man go!

products.name: Squash - Chayote
products.description: A cute, Colombian squash that makes the perfect addition to soups and stir fry's

products.name: Beef - Kobe Striploin
products.description: Kobe's favorite beef! Need we say more? RIP

products.name: Pork - Bacon
products.description: Our bacon will have you beggin' for more!

products.name: Pork - European Side Bacon
products.description: European bacon is not always as satisfying as the crispy, streaky bacon that we are used to. It is made from the loin of a pig, and this means it is mostly meat, with a thin strip of fat on the top. It is much leaner than the American version of bacon.

products.name: Pepper - Cayenne
products.description: cultivated in Mexico 7,000 years ago and in Peru 4,000 years ago. Native Americans have used cayenne as a food and as a medicine for stomach aches, cramping pains, gas , and disorders of the circulatory system for 9,000 years. Cayenne was brought to Europe in the fifteenth century by Christopher Columbus.

products.name: Cheese - Feta
products.description: The Greek word feta (φέτα) comes from the Italian fetta 'slice', which in turn is derived from the Latin offa 'morsel, piece'. The word feta became widespread as a name for the cheese only in the 19th century, probably referring to the cheese being cut to pack it in barrels.
